conclusion: Determine the time it takes for the laser beam to travel from point A to point C through the transparent brick and emerge from the arc surface ABC.
The laser beam travels from point A to point C via the transparent brick.
The refractive index \( n \) of the transparent material will affect how the beam bends as it enters and exits the brick.
Calculate the time \( t_1 \) taken to travel from A to C: \( t_1 = \frac{2r}{v} \).
Determine the angle of incidence and refraction using Snell's Law. Since \( \theta_i = 0^\circ \), \( \theta_r = 0^\circ \).
Since the beam travels straight through the brick, the time \( t_2 \) taken to travel through the brick is \( t_2 = \frac{2r}{v} \).
The time \( t_3 \) taken for the beam to travel from the exit point on the arc to the point where it emerges is negligible.
The total time \( t \) for the laser beam to travel from A to C and emerge from the arc surface ABC is \( t = \frac{4r}{v} \).
